thread.title: Chris Brooks replacing injured U.S. gymnastics champ Mikulak on world team
thread.title_full: Chris Brooks replacing injured U.S. gymnastics champ Mikulak on world team

title: Chris Brooks replacing injured U.S. gymnastics champ Mikulak on world team
text:
Chris Brooks competes on the high bar during the senior P&G gymnastics championships at Bankers Life Fieldhouse on Aug. 16, 2015. (Photo: Marc Lebryk-USA TODAY Sports)
1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE GLASGOW, Scotland — Five years after last competing at the world gymnastics championships, Chris Brooks is back in the U.S. lineup.
Brooks was chosen Thursday to replace three-time U.S. champion Sam Mikulak, who was forced out of worlds earlier this month with a slight tear in his left Achilles. Brooks and fellow alternate Marvin Kimble both came to Glasgow, and U.S. officials made the decision on who would take Mikulak’s spot after watching them train.
Olympic bronze medalist Danell Leyva; Donnell Whittenburg; Alex Naddour, Paul Ruggeri; and Brandon Wynn make up the rest of the U.S. team, which begins competition Monday. The Americans must finish in the top eight to secure a spot at next summer’s Rio Olympics.
Being added to the lineup caps an impressive comeback for the 28-year-old Brooks, who has been slowed by injuries since being an alternate on the 2012 Olympic team.
Brooks' only other appearance at worlds was in 2010, when the U.S. men finished fourth. He was an alternate on the 2011 world team that won the bronze medal.
